results.title: China Rising
results.creator_credit: Gwyneth Hughes, Yorkshire Television and Granite Productions
results.brief_description: A series of three two part programs that detail the history of China during a number of tumultuous stages in its history. The first program explores the period in Chinese history between the 1920s through to the 1940s, seen through the eyes of the people living in Shanghai, as the country moved from the colonial rule of the English and Japanese and the disjointed rule of the warlords to a unification movement led by the Nationalists under Chiang Kai-Shek and subsequent attempts by the Japanese to regain control. The second two part program covers the history of Communist China from the mid 1930s to the 1960s, where the chinese Communists retreated following defeat by the Nationalists in the walk later known as the Long March, only to regroup and counter attack in the form of the Peoples Liberation Army to drive the Nationalists out of power and to exile in Taiwan. Part three of the series covers the period of Mao’s Cultural Revolution and the subsequent changes which inspired the student democracy movement of the late 1980’s through discussion of the revolution’s impact on families and the classes and the economic reforms of the 1980s following the revolutions decline. This comphrehensive documentary uses rare archival footage and interviews with the chinese people of the time and engages with the impact this constantly revolutionary period of Chinese history had on their lives. Each program in the series includes Teachers notes.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gwyneth Hughes, Yorkshire Television and Granite Productions

results.title: Discovering the world
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Children Thinking”.
First of four studies of the development of thinking in children from five to ten. Shows how their drawing and painting expresses understanding of their environment and traces its development.

results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Children Thinking”.
Final in the series. Shows the children’s attitudes to rules and conventions of behaviour, showing recognition of the need and adoption of their own rules for games as authoritative.

results.title: The Moon follows me (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Children Thinking”.
In the second of the series the children’s thinking is shown to be logical but limited by reliance on direct perceptual evidence and by inability to imagine other viewpoints.

results.title: 'Cos its naughty
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Children Thinking”.
Interaction between parent and child in the child’s growing understanding of right and wrong. How does the child know what a lie is? How he is to being understanding the framework of good and naughty imposed upon him by the adults?

results.title: I'll find a way
results.creator_credit: Beverly Shaffer, Kathleen Shannon, Yuki Yoshida and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Children of Canada”.
When nine-year-old Nadia is allowed to attend a regular school, she knows the kids will tease her but she’ll “find a way to deal with it.” Nadia has spina bifida, a congenital condition that has caused a lack of sensation from the knees down. She uses crutches in order to walk. Nadia, in her own candid way, makes it clear that she is not looking for sympathy. She can do many things that children do, only she has a different way of doing them. (Ten Awards including Oscar, Hollywood; Salerno; Dubuque)
